The golfing mecca is upon us so let's look at the 2020 Masters odds from two perspectives. The sportsbooks and our Golf Model. Our Model, which we go into more detail on down the bottom, was developed by one of the sharpest sports betting data scientists in the world. In this article, we'll share: * The winning predictions from our Model * How that compares to the market * Who we're backing to win the 2020 Masters * Head to head betting matchups * Group betting matchups All your betting needs are covered, using the most up to date data sources and a sharp betting Model. Without further ado, what are The Masters odds and who are we betting on? - - - ## **Masters Odds & Predictions** Following the Houston Open, where DJ and Brooks showed vintage form, here's the Model outputs:
So where is the value this week? Well we compare it to [Oddschecker](https://www.oddschecker.com/us/golf/the-masters/2020-us-masters/winner) for the US sportsbook prices. - - - ## **2020 Masters Picks** We actually ran the Model last week, before the Houston Open, to see if we could find some early value. We recommended **Webb Simpson** and **Patrick Cantlay**. These two Americans are ranked sixth and eighth, respectively, on our sports betting **[World Golf Rankings](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/world-golf-rankings)**. We're very happy to be on both for The Masters. Simpson is 33-1 at FanDuel and 30-1 at most sportsbooks. That's higher than his true probability according to our Model. Cantlay, unfortuantely, has tumbled in price. We got him at 30-1. If you can get 28-1 or higher, bet him too. Maybe you have an odds boost to catch the price we took? ## **What About The Favourites?** We're very tempted to back **Xander Schauffele**. He's the best golfer in the world according to our Model. And he's a tiny overlay at FanDuel (15-1 vs 14-1). - - - ## **Final 2020 Masters Picks** **Patrick Cantlay**. We love him. Should be 25-1, he's 30-1. **Webb Simpson**. Another beast that the Model loves in 2020. You can get 33-1 at Fanduel, when the Model makes him the eighth best player in the field, and 28-1. - - - ## **Why Should I Care About Your Model?** Glad you asked. Firstly, our chief data scientist is no joke. He makes a healthy living by betting off his sports models. His most recent, our golf model, uses the last 15 years of data to produce win predictions for PGA tournaments. The model can be broken down into three stages: 1. **Historic score adjustment** Firstly, historic golf scores are adjusted to account for varying course difficulty and conditions on the day. For example a "-2" on a certain course/day combination may be an average score but on another course/day combination it might be a great score due to the course being more difficult and/or unfavorable conditions. This adjustment is necessary so that we can compare players on a like for like basis. 2. **Score prediction** We then create features using the adjusted historic scores and run a few machine learning algorithms on top of these, weighting each equally. These provide an accurate prediction for the most likely score that a player will achieve on an average course in the future. 3. **Simulation** Using these future score predictions, for a given tournament we can then simulate each player's score using their own score distribution to come up with win percentages and fair odds for each player in a tournament. - - - ## **More Golf Betting Expertise** If you love betting on golf like us, check out our **[Top 50 World Golf Rankings](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/world-golf-rankings)**. We update them every week. Plus we have a **[How To Bet On Golf Guide](https://www.betrefinery.com/golf-betting/how-to-bet-on-golf)** that we think you'll love too. Whilst we might play off 22 when we go around the course, our golf betting is off scratch.
